applyTo: "**/*.md,**/*.mdx"

## STYLE

- [P0-MUST] Use present tense: "The function returns" not "The function will return".
- [P0-MUST] All code examples must be correct and runnable.
- [P1-SHOULD] Use active voice: "Run the command" not "The command should be run".
- [P1-SHOULD] Write directly and concisely. Remove filler words.
- [P2-MAY] Use second person ("you") for instructions and guides.

## STRUCTURE

- [P1-SHOULD] Start with a clear title and one-sentence description.
- [P1-SHOULD] Use headings (##, ###) to organize content hierarchically.
- [P1-SHOULD] Keep paragraphs short — 3-4 sentences maximum.
- [P1-SHOULD] Use bullet points for lists, numbered lists for sequential steps.

## CODE_EXAMPLES

- [P0-MUST] Use fenced code blocks with language identifiers.
- [P1-SHOULD] Include necessary imports and context — examples should be self-contained.
- [P2-MAY] Show expected output when the result is not obvious.

## LINKS

- [P1-SHOULD] Use relative links for internal documentation: `[API guide](./api-guide.md)`.
- [P1-SHOULD] Link to related documents rather than duplicating content.
- [P0-MUST] Check that all links resolve to existing files.

## GRAMMAR

- [P1-SHOULD] Use consistent terminology. Define terms on first use if unfamiliar.
- [P1-SHOULD] Spell out acronyms on first use: "Model Context Protocol (MCP)".
- [P2-MAY] Use Oxford comma in lists.
